intro: Borreria argentea f. elegans, commonly known as silverleaf borreria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which results from dense pubescence covering the leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
